meanings.sent1: After the storm, they reconsolidated their efforts to rebuild the house.
meanings.sent2: The team reconsolidated their positions before launching the final attack.
meanings.sent3: The ants reconsolidated their forces to protect their anthill from the invading beetles.
meanings.sent4: She reconsolidated her resolve to finish the marathon despite the pain.
meanings.sent5: The students reconsolidated their knowledge before the big exam.

meanings.definition: To strengthen or make more solid again.
meanings.sent1: The company reconsolidated its financial position after the successful merger.
meanings.sent2: The glue reconsolidated the broken pieces of the vase back together.
meanings.sent3: The superhero reconsolidated his powers to defeat the villain once and for all.
meanings.sent4: Her determination reconsolidated her commitment to achieving her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The friendship reconsolidated after the misunderstanding was cleared up.
